item.title: CSS overflow-wrap: break-word
item.description:
When designing for the web, one small but important detail is how browsers handle very long words or strings of text. On mobile screens especially, an unbroken word can stretch beyond the viewport and cause horizontal scrolling â€” something no user enjoys.

The modern solution is simple: add this to your stylesheet:

body {
 overflow-wrap: break-word;
}

With this rule in place, the browser can gracefully break long words when needed, ensuring text always stays inside the screen width.
